news.title: HC upholds Bengaluru development body's land acquisition for Banashankari VI Stage
news.para: The High Court has upheld the Bangalore Development Authority's (BDA) land acquisition for the Banashankari VI Stage extension. Dismissing appeals, the court found the acquisition process lawful and fair, noting substantial implementation of the development scheme. The bench emphasized that urban expansion and public interest outweighed individual claims.

news.title: Telangana HC dismisses Union Bank of India’s appeal over property auction
news.para: The Telangana High Court has dismissed the Union Bank of India's appeal. The court found the bank failed to follow proper legal procedures during an auction. A property belonging to a city-based company under liquidation was sold for a lower price.

news.title: Ghaziabad development body cuts interest rate on properties
news.para: Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) has reduced its property interest rate from 10.7% to 8.7%, aligning with the State Bank of India's rates as mandated by the state government. This move, along with a reduced EMI penalty from 3% to 2%, aims to boost consumer sentiment and accelerate the sale of 1,748 unsold dwelling units.

news.title: Court rules zero GST on transfer of MIDC plots to third party
news.para: Businesses transferring MIDC plots to a third party will not attract GST. The Nagpur bench of the Bombay High Court upheld this decision. This ruling provides relief to many businesses facing GST notices. The court followed a Gujarat High Court precedent. This clarifies a long-standing tax ambiguity for genuine business transfers across Maharashtra.

news.title: Punjab government makes registration of cooperative housing societies affordable, secure
news.para: The Punjab government is simplifying property registration processes in cooperative housing societies, making them more budget-friendly. Original allottees and their heirs are exempt from paying stamp duty, while non-original allottees enjoy reduced rates until March 2026.

news.title: Ready-mix concrete plant in Mumbai's Powai gets MPCB notice
news.para: A ready-mix concrete plant in Powai faces action for violating environmental and operational rules. The Maharashtra Pollution Control Board issued a notice after identifying issues like uncovered cement silos and lack of tyre-washing systems. The plant also failed in scientific sludge management and dust suppression.

news.title: Punjab cuts reserve prices by 22% to unlock unsold Gmada properties
news.para: Punjab government has approved a significant reduction in reserve prices for unsold Gmada properties, averaging 22%. This policy aims to revive buyer interest and generate Rs 5,000-10,000 crore by making stalled public assets more accessible. The move is expected to boost real estate transactions across development authorities.

news.title: BA Continuum India inks ₹236-crore lease for office in Mumbai's Powai
news.para: In a bold move that reflects the surging demand for commercial spaces, BA Continuum India, a subsidiary of Bank of America, has locked in a prime office location in the bustling district of Powai, Mumbai. The lease agreement extends over nearly 11 years, with an impressive rental obligation exceeding Rs 236 crore.

news.title: Unity Mall project not in wetland zone, has all clearances: Goa goverment
news.para: In an encouraging update for the Unity Mall project in Chimbel, Goa’s government has confirmed that it is moving forward with all necessary approvals. Tourism Minister Rohan Khaunte reassured legislators that the project site is clear of any designated wetland conservation zones.

news.title: UK's Persimmon offers cautious outlook after beating 2025 sales' expectations
news.para: Persimmon, a British homebuilder, exceeded sales expectations in 2025. The company anticipates moderate growth in 2026. However, Persimmon expresses caution regarding demand, particularly from institutional buyers. Recent mortgage rate reductions offer some relief for private customers.

news.title: China Vanke seeks a further 90-day grace period for $290 million bond: Sources
news.para: China Vanke is making headlines as it seeks a 90-day reprieve on a 2 billion yuan bond repayment. Bondholders will soon cast their votes on fresh proposals amid this pivotal moment.

news.title: 2025 was decent, but end-user demand softened as prices jumped: Parveen Jain, president, NAREDCO National
news.para: In India, the housing sector is currently facing a wave of price hikes attributed to climbing land and construction costs. This surge is making it tough for many buyers to enter the market. Consequently, developers are pondering a return to mid-range housing as the appetite for luxury homes levels off.

news.title: Omaxe to invest ₹500 crore to develop mixed-use Omaxe Chowk project in Ludhiana
news.para: Omaxe is investing ₹500 crore in Omaxe Chowk, a new mixed-use project in Ludhiana. This development will offer convenient walk-to-shop options. The project  is set to be delivered by June 2030.

news.title: Builders seek EDC relief, higher affordable housing prices from Haryana government
news.para: Haryana's real estate developers have taken the initiative to submit an in-depth set of policy suggestions to the state government, designed to kickstart the economy. Their proposals focus on reinvigorating halted projects, alleviating regulatory burdens, and making housing more accessible to the public.

news.title: Tushar Infra Developers & Pantheon Buildcon sell property in Mumbai for ₹559.25 crore
news.para: Tushar Infra Developers and Pantheon Buildcon have sold a commercial property in Chandivali, Mumbai. The deal for the Balaji IT Park property is valued at ₹559.25 crore. The property has a built-up area of approximately 30,195 square meters.

news.title: About 548 families still awaiting allotments under Karnataka CM’s ₹1-lakh housing scheme
news.para: Administrative confusion between Greater Bengaluru Authority and Rajiv Gandhi Housing Corporation Limited has left 548 families in limbo, despite fully built homes being ready for allotment. Beneficiaries, who paid Rs 1 lakh years ago, staged a protest as officials cited delays in receiving the final allottee list from GBA. The list is now promised by January 31.

news.title: Tidco sets up model houses for villagers under Parandur airport resettlement plan
news.para: Tidco has built model houses for families to be relocated for the proposed Parandur greenfield airport in Kancheepuram district. Villagers can choose from different designs of 400 sqft houses, with options for cash compensation or alternative housing sites. The state government has also released a relief package for affected residents.

news.title: Anant Nagar plot registration till January 16: Lucknow development body
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority has extended the online registration deadline for 637 residential plots in the Anant Nagar housing scheme to January 16 due to overwhelming public interest. This decision follows a strong response to the scheme, which is being developed over 785 acres and includes plans for parks and an Edutech City.

news.title: Property Share files for ₹244-crore IPO of third SM REIT scheme
news.para: Property Share Investment Trust has filed draft IPO papers for PropShare Celestia. The issue size is up to Rs 244.65 crore. Investors gain access to a Grade A+ asset in Ahmedabad.
